TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG and Highways expropriated a plot of land belonging to the applicant . A committee of experts assessed the value of the expropriated land and this amount was paid to him when the expropriation took place .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant 's request for increased compensation , on CARDINAL DATE ORG Instance awarded him additional compensation plus interest at the statutory rate running from the date of the expropriation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of the first - instance court in respect of the commencement date for the calculation of the interest .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of First Instance confirmed its previous judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the aforementioned judgment .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , the applicant initiated execution proceedings ( icra takibi ) against ORG via ORG in order to enforce the payment of the compensation awarded by the first instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was paid MONEY ( TRL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an action with ORG and requested compensation for the loss sustained as a result of late payment and inflation , pursuant to LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant 's request . On DATE ORG upheld the aforementioned judgment .
CARDINAL . According to the letter dated DATE from ORG , ORG of Highways still owed GPE CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) to the applicant .

CARDINAL . Referring to the General Directorate of Highways ' letter dated DATE , the Government claimed that they had paid the total amount due and that the ORG 's office had struck out the case concerning the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . NORP However , in a letter dated DATE , the ORG 's office stated that ORG of Highways still owed MONEY to the applicant .
